articles.title: Tourist from Argentina tests Covid positive outside Taj Mahal, goes missing
articles.description: The police and health department personnel in Agra are now scrambling to trace his whereabouts as the contact number he had provided was inaccurate.
articles.content:
A tourist from Argentina, who tested positive for Covid-19 in an antigen test at the Taj Mahal entrance gate on Monday, has gone missing, leaving Agra police and health department personnel scrambling to trace his whereabouts.

articles.title: Argentina Man Untraceable After Testing Covid-19 Positive In Agra, Had Visited Taj Mahal
articles.description: Coronavirus news: Argentina tourist who visited the Taj Mahal in Agra tested positive for COVID-19. He is now untraceable as his personal information turned out to be false.
articles.content: A 48-YEAR-OLD foreign tourist from Argentina, who visited the Taj Mahal in Uttar Pradesh's Agra, tested positive for covid-19. His sample was collected during screening at the entry gate for the virus when he visited the monument on December 26. The ... [1778 chars]

articles.title: Gakpo says Dutch skipper Van Dijk persuaded him to join Liverpool
articles.description: Gakpo, who scored three goals at the World Cup before the Dutch went out in the quarter-finals to eventual champions Argentina, joined Liverpool from PSV Eindhoven on Wednesday for a reported initial fee of 37 million pounds ($44.56 million).
articles.content:
Dutch forward Cody Gakpo said he was persuaded to join Liverpool by Netherlands skipper Virgil van Dijk, who also plays at the Premier League club.
